reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars didn’t see the ending coming
reviews.reviewText: Would rate a 4.5 if I could. This booked hooked me in from the very beginning. I found myself struggling with who I wanted to take sides with throughout the book. I instantly felt empathy for Theo and what he had been for. I found myself wanting to give him a hug, almost the way he described feeling about Alicia at times. Even when it becomes clear that Theo and Alicia’s stories come together, I found myself in denial that Alicia did it until the last couple of chapters. Your heart breaks for Alicia as her story unravels throughout the entire book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I had seen raving reviews over this, so I thought I'd give it a whirl. I'm normally an easy read romance reader who has been expanding her reading genres. I have to say that throughout most of the book, which did hold my interest, I kept wondering why people thought this was a good book. Its towards the end when I discovered... Oh dang, this book IS fantastic!In my wise middle age, I often find myself guessing right away who could be the culprit of many "crimes"....from left their dirty socks in the hallway to who left the backdoor wide open...Mystery novels are not my typical genre preference but when I do five them a go, I tend to try my best to figure out who, what, where, when and why. With The Silent Patient, I honestly had no clue and when i got to the last few pages it was quite the surprise! Absolutely great writing and I can't wait to read more from Alex Michaelides.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars the layers of storytelling
reviews.reviewText: Wow. I don’t have the words for this book. It kept me in the edge of my seat. I was suspended between reality and delusions. What is truth and where is motivation? In the beginning I kept turning the pages because I wanted to get into Alicia’s mind and I wanted her to speak. Half-way through, I wanted the identity of the man hiding. I wanted the identity of Kathy’s lover. I wanted to discover the origins of Max’s infatuation. I wanted to learn more about Jean-Felix even if he was shady. But most of all…I wanted to solve Gabriel’s murder.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the twisty end reveal
reviews.reviewText: Right out the gate we know she kills her husband and after just goes silent. The book got a little slow towards the middle and I was really thinking okay now, what does this psychiatrist have to do with this because most the book talks about him and when does she break her silence?? In the end once everything unfolded I was happy and overall enjoyed this book

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars so close to climactic
reviews.reviewText: I want to start by saying I do not regret this read nor did I ever consider DNFing it. However, for me it fell just short of what I hoped it could be. I almost feel frustrated at how close it was to being a mind-bending, psyche-altering experience. But it just missed the 5-star mark by a hair - purely due to the fact that I predicted the ending.Now for preface, I knew there was a twist, so for the whole story I found myself trying to piece it together. It did its job by thrilling me and popping into my everyday thoughts/daydreaming. But because I thought about it so often when I wasn’t able to read it, I pieced it together before I finished.If you are not as stubborn as me to finish the puzzle too early, then it is a great, thrilling read. And I think I am on a thriller kick now - next up, Gone Girl (as recommended by the author).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This book was wonderful, constantly wondering what is going on, your mind thinking of all possibilities, and then when you get to the point of omg! It is like wow! The author did an amazing job introducing each character , and it was easy to keep up with. This book definitely had me sitting on the edge of my seat looking forward to reading and learning more of this wondering novel. Some books I have to keep notes to remember who is who but this book was wonderful where I was introduced to each character and I didn’t need to write notes and look back to refresh my memory. I finished this book in a few days and I love that kind of read!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This book was so well written, and the twists and turns! ... The metaphors and analogies running all the way through it and connecting everything in the end, which was a complete and total surprise, TOTALLY unexpected. It's not how I wanted it to end, but hey, we don't always get happily ever after and just what we suspect will happen from the beginning of the book.We had been reading historical non-fiction, so this was a great change. It's the kind of book you don't want to put down, or you make time to read even though you might not have time to read!Don't hesitate to read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I never considered this to be a genre I'd enjoy to this level. I'm not even truly sure how to express how much I enjoyed this book. Everytime I thought I figured it out I was wrong. You feel so many different emotions as you go through the twists in this story.Alicia is the silent patient who murdered her husband and is now in a psych ward. For years no one has gotten through to her and she hasn't spoken since the murder. In steps Theo a psychotherapist who tries to understand his patients, to listen and to talk. His main goal is to help Alicia after seeing the painting she did after killing her husband.This book entails so much. There is excerpts from Alicia's diary, there's Theos opinions on what's going on, I don't want to give to much away because it's so good. I didn't think I would enjoy this as much as I did but I saw in the authors end discussion notes that he was a fan of Agatha Christie, which is also one of my favorite authors. I can see why I enjoyed it so much after knowing he was influenced by writing like hers!

reviews.reviewTitle: Me prendeu do início ao fim!
reviews.reviewText: O livro é muito muito muito bom! Um dos melhores suspenses. Me prendeu do início ao fim. Fiquei muito curiosa e instigada. E foi divertido que a autora repete um personagem de “The Silente Patient” em sua outra obra “The Maidens”, a qual também recomendo. Foi legal ver um personagem que eu já conhecia num próximo livro. Sacada genial!

reviews.reviewTitle: Gripping story with an unexpected twist
reviews.reviewText: I am not much of a book reader, so I thought of giving this book a shot and I can say this one has a thrilling story which kept me hooked till last. I took around 5 days to finish, and the twist at last was so unexpected. The writing is easy to understand. At times, I felt like certain parts were slow and not important, but it all falls in place ultimately.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this book some time ago but had only got round to reading it and read it in a few hours. I'd previously read The Maidens by this author and adored it so really glad to say this book does live up to the hype!I'm a massive fan of a thriller and more so ones that have a twist to the tale. the twist in this book was so intelligently woven into the story and didn't cheapen the impact at all. The way it's written I'm actually so annoyed at myself that I didn't spot it!! Just a sublime book to get lost in and well drawn characters and very clever writing.

reviews.reviewTitle: One of the best thrillers I have read!
reviews.reviewText: I loved everthing about this book. Can't wait for the next novel by this author! Just amazing!
